# quadmesh

Build a "quadmesh"" in R. 

```R
library(quadmesh)
library(raster)
data(volcano)
r <- setExtent(raster(volcano), extent(0, 100, 0, 200))


qm <- quadmesh(r)

library(rgl)
scl <- function(x) (x - min(x))/diff(range(x))
shade3d(qm, col = grey(scl(qm$vb[3,qm$ib])))
```

A "quadmesh" is a dense mesh describing a topologically continuous surface of 4-corner primitives. I.e. a grid, without the "regular".
